article.headline: Old Dominion 74, VMI 52
article.story: NORFOLK, Va. (AP) -- Arnaud Dahi was 6-of-8 from the field and scored 15 points to lead Old Dominion to a 74-52 victory over VMI on Monday night. Dahi hit all five of his shots in the first, including a 3-pointer, and had 11 points as the Monarchs (5-4) took a 34-20 halftime lead. VMI led 8-7 before Old Dominion went on an 8-0 run to take the lead for good. Isaiah Hunter scored 14 points for the Monarchs, while Valdas Vasylius had 11 and Alex Loughton 10. Richard Little led the Keydets (2-8) with 17 points and seven assists. Sam Mielnik added 11 points. VMI shot 40 percent from the field, while the Monarchs hit 47 percent.
